body_html:
I experience the same issue as @XuefeiW , however I also occasionally (and inconsistently) experience an error message @fmassa , I assume neither of these are the intended behavior?
so running:

a = torch.Tensor(2,3)
print(a[1:2,3:4])

returns either
tensor([ 0.])
or
if value != math.ceil(value.item()):
RuntimeError: Overflow when unpacking long

I am using python 3.6.4, IPython 6.2.1, pytorch 0.4.0

Thanks

body:
I experience the same issue as @XuefeiW , however I also occasionally (and inconsistently) experience an error message @fmassa , I assume neither of these are the intended behavior?
so running:

a = torch.Tensor(2,3)
print(a[1:2,3:4])

returns either 
tensor([ 0.])
or 
if value != math.ceil(value.item()):
RuntimeError: Overflow when unpacking long

I am using python 3.6.4, IPython 6.2.1, pytorch 0.4.0

Thanks
